ygData.subject: Re: Concerns With SK Class
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi! Did you ever think about the fact that the harm touch description could be intended to be read in a non-literal fashion. I agree that HT is somewhat weak.
ygData.messageBody:
Hi!

Did you ever think about the fact that the harm touch description could be
intended to be read in a non-literal fashion.

I agree that HT is somewhat weak. Though im not sure what to do about
it...I've never had an HT resisted while fighting creatures 8-10 levels
above me.

Really, I'd like to see HT as a constant ability...One that decreases the
casters health and mana with each cast.

>From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
>Reply-To: shadowknight@onelist.com
>To: shadowknight@onelist.com
>Subject: [shadowknight] Re: Concerns With SK Class
>Date: Mon, 26 Apr 1999 17:46:03 -0700 (PDT)
>
>From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
>
>The pets we get , even though relatively weak, i have no complaints
>about.
>And i was never insinuating that Harm Touch should kill anything in one
>hit. And if you count on HT to beat anything you attack, you get what
>you deserve. BUT, thats no excuse for it not working, in my opinion. If
>it works to its full potential and you still die, which has happened to
>me, then so be it. But it should be something you can count on to at
>least work when an emergency arises.
>And in no way am i saying that SKs are powerless or have no potential.
>However HT still is not the equal of LoH which its supposed to be.
>
>Regardless of our differences of opinion on this, i would like to know
>what you feel would be an effective way to bring our concerns to the
>Dev team, whatever they may be.
>
>Thanks for responding,
>
>Bathory
>Cazic-Thule
>
>--- Leif Smart <leifsmart@...> wrote:

> >

> > of those annoying rusty short swords, since it makes
> > the pet more effective. And
> > alos, it is a great delaying and early warning
> > device. My pet has saved me from
> > giants on a number of times.
> >
> > Inos
